intro: Daucus gummifer, commonly known as the gummed parsley, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its fruits are small, dry, and contain a single seed, typical of the Apiaceae family. Daucus gummifer is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
